byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

abstract: New York Times correspondents John Eligon and Sheryl Gay Stolberg have reported on events in Baltimore over past year; share excerpts from conversation in which they discuss current mind-set of city that is about to elect a new mayor and will soon see resumption of long-delayed trials of six police officers charged in 2015 death of black man Freddie Gray.
lead_paragraph: A year after the arrest of Freddie Gray, correspondents who have covered events in Baltimore since then took stock of the city’s mood and politics.

headline.main: Baltimore After Freddie Gray: The ‘Mind-Set Has Changed’
headline.print_headline: A Year After Gray’s Arrest, ‘Baltimore’s Mind-Set Has Changed’

snippet: A year after the arrest of Freddie Gray, correspondents who have covered events in Baltimore since then took stock of the city’s mood and politics.
